thread.title: GM Raises Its Bet on India
thread.title_full: GM Raises Its Bet on India

title: GM Raises Its Bet on India
text:
GM to Introduce 10 New Vehicles in India The auto maker is developing a new family of Chevrolets with China’s SAIC Motor By santanu.choudhury@wsj.com Updated July 29, 2015 10:49 a.m. ET 
NEW DELHI—General Motors Co. will invest $1 billion in India as it recalibrates its efforts in Asia’s third-largest economy by shutting down one factory while increasing production in another and focusing on new models. 
The Detroit auto maker will use the money to launch 10 locally produced Chevrolet vehicles in India over the next five years, said Stefan Jacoby, head of GM’s international operations. The company currently produces... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
